abstract: In its annual report, Hewlett-Packard discusses the methodology it employed when making the $8.8 billion charge, but it does not break out exactly how purported accounting improprieties were behind $5 billion of that charge.
snippet: In its annual report, Hewlett-Packard discusses the methodology it employed when making the $8.8 billion charge, but it does not break out exactly how purported accounting improprieties were behind $5 billion of that charge.
lead_paragraph: The $5 billion fight over accusations of improper accounting brought by Hewlett-Packard shows no sign of abating.

headline.main: Questions Remain Over Hewlett’s Big Charge on Autonomy Acquisition
